intro: Aldama breviflosculosa, commonly known as the short-flowered aldama, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, making it a distinctive member of its genus. It is often found in arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
